intro: Campylocentrum burchellii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight. Campylocentrum burchellii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
